title: constructors are not flexible at all in PyTorch 0.4
body_html:
This was working in PyTorch 0.3:

torch.zeros(torch.LongTensor([2, 3]).max())

But now it gives:

TypeError: zeros(): argument 'size' (position 1) must be tuple of ints, not Tensor

And we have to write:

torch.zeros(torch.LongTensor([2, 3]).max().item())

Which in my opinion is not very nice. Many things are broken since the 0.4 upgrade, and the lack of flexibility is now quite annoying. What was the decision behind this? np.zeros(np.array([2, 3]).max()) is working after all.

A bit related to #8365
